meanings.definition: A large room containing many beds, typically in a school or institution.
meanings.sent1: The dormitories at the school were filled with bunk beds.
meanings.sent2: Students often share dormitories when they attend college.
meanings.sent3: The dormitories were so crowded that it felt like a giant sleepover every night.
meanings.sent4: The dormitories resembled a beehive with all the beds packed closely together.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dormitories stayed in his mind long after graduation.

meanings.definition: A building providing living quarters for a number of people, typically students.
meanings.sent1: The new dormitories on campus were modern and spacious.
meanings.sent2: Living in dormitories can be a fun experience for young adults.
meanings.sent3: The dormitories were like a mini village within the university.
meanings.sent4: The dormitories stood tall, welcoming students from all over.
meanings.sent5: The dormitories buzzed with activity during exam week.
